sentence.Network_en: They started to mend the woodwork and paint the walls.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们开始修补木建部分，粉刷墙壁。

sentence.Network_en: He could see the glimmer of fresh paint on the woodwork.
sentence.Network_cn: 他可以看到木构件上新刷的油漆泛着光。

sentence.Network_en: The hall is decorated in bright orangey-red with black and gold woodwork.
sentence.Network_cn: 整个大厅用鲜艳的橘红色装饰，木建部分漆成黑色和金色。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of an unpleasant person or thing) emerge from obscurity; be revealed
jx.jx_cn_mean: （令人不快的人或物）从阴暗的角落出现；公开露面

jx.jx_en_mean: Out of obscurity or a place of seclusion

lj.lj_ly: People were coming out of the woodwork to apply for the plummy job.
lj.lj_ls: 人们正走出卑微的境地去申请上等的工作

entry.def: You can refer to the doors and other wooden parts of a house as the woodwork .

example.ex: I love the living room, with its dark woodwork, oriental rugs, and chunky furniture...
example.tran: 我喜欢起居室那深色的木构件、东方地毯和厚重的家具。

example.ex: He could see the glimmer of fresh paint on the woodwork.
example.tran: 他可以看到木构件上新刷的油漆泛着光。

entry.def: Woodwork is the activity or skill of making things out of wood.

example.ex: I have done woodwork for many years...
Joseph instructs a class in woodwork.
example.tran: 约瑟夫教一个班木工课。

entry.tran: 突然跳出来;突然冒出来
entry.def: If you say that people are coming out of the woodwork, you are criticizing them for suddenly appearing in public or revealing their opinions when previously they did not make themselves known.

example.ex: When a song gets to the top, someone will come out of the woodwork and claim to have written it.
example.tran: 当一首歌非常流行的时候，有人就会跳出来，说是自己写的。

means.word_mean: 1. work made of wood; especially moldings or stairways or furniture
2. the craft of a carpenter: making things out of wood

means.word_mean: 默默无闻；销声匿跡；蛰伏

sentences.en: I decided the best thing to do would be to try and fade into the woodwork and hope that no one noticed me.
sentences.cn: 我认为最好的办法就是尽量销声匿跡，希望没人注意我。

sentences.en: When he won the lottery, all sorts of distant relatives came out of the woodwork.
sentences.cn: 他博彩中奖后，八竿子打不着的亲戚都突然登门造访。
